title: As a user I want to see an error if I am entering a new grandfathered player profile that has the same national ID as another player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating Grandfathered Profile
AND user is entering a new grandfathered player profile that has the same national ID as another player
custom_steps: WHEN user clicking "Next" on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN the system will run a duplicate profile check according to the provided rules (National ID Only for this story). 
AND If a National ID is entered, the system should check to see if any other International Amateur profile already exists with the same National ID and Country.  
AND If another international amateur profile is found with the same National ID and National ID country, the user gets a hard error. See Messages #7
-- "You cannot create a profile for this player because one already exists." --
AND If no match is found, the user is able to proceed with profile creation. 

*Because there are no visibility rules around grandfathered players - this works the same for all users*

Business Rules:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787792/4+of+7+Check

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches-_grandfathered

Messages #7: 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787668/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to create a new Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user navigates to International tab
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "New Player" on International dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN System will load Create New Player form.
AND user will see the "Register" button is disabled until all of the required fields have been entered. 
AND The National ID fields are conditionally required based on the selection of "Birth Country", and this should be reflected via the red asterisks displayed on the UI. 
AND Entering the required fields on the Create New form, including a DOB on or after 9/1/1995 will take the user to a new registration profile, per the data discovery and wireframe. 
AND There are a lot of conditionally displayed fields on these profiles, so the data discovery should be paid special attention. 
AND The Registration Reviews and Means of Contact sections are not visible on create. 
AND Any action buttons and calculated fields (Eligible to Sign date/Meets Age Requirements) are handled in follow up stories.

Data Discovery: 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787669/EBIS4-TXT-5831+Data+Discovery+2.5

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a user I want to save a new Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND User is in the create new player form
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Save" on the new Registration profile form
custom_expected:
THEN The system runs a required field and formatting check per the provided data discovery, saves the profile and a blue successful save notification is thrown. 
AND Fields are conditionally required, especially upload labels, so the data discovery should be paid special attention. 
AND The Registration status should be set to "Pending BOC Review" on save.
OR If the user Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel. If they confirm, the user is returned to the point of entry and no profile is stored. If they do not confirm, they are returned to the profile in edit mode. 


Data Discovery: 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787669/EBIS4-TXT-5831+Data+Discovery+2.5

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a Club user I want to edit an existing Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user is logged in with Edit Permissions for existing Registration Profile
AND user is viewing a Registration Profile in View mode
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Edit" button
custom_expected:
THEN system will reload the profile in edit mode per the data discovery.
AND the majority of the profile fields are NOT editable for Club users if the player Elig to Sign date is not pass 
BUT the majority of the profile fields are editable for Club user if the Elig to sign date for player has passed expect these fields ( First Name, Last Name, and Extended Last Name)
AND Previously attached files that have been saved are NOT editable for the Club users, though they can add additional attached files. 
AND The entire Contact Information section remains editable for the Club users. 
AND There will be a "Save" and a "Cancel" button available in edit mode. 
AND No Origin toggles appear for the Club user in edit mode UNLESS it appears in View mode (meaning there are already 2 versions of the same Org's contact info/attached files from a profile merge). 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any unsaved changes. If they confirm, the system will reload the profile in View mode, with no changes made. 
OR Clicking "Save" will run a required field and formatting check. Assuming the required field and format check passes, the system will reload the profile in View mode, with the changes stored and visible. 
AND The locked fields apply to anything other than players with a status of "Unregistered".

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a BOC user I want to edit an existing Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Edit Permissions for existing Registration Profile
AND user is viewing a Registration Profile in View mode
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Edit" button
custom_expected:
THEN the system will reload the profile in edit mode per the data discovery. All previously editable fields remain editable for the BOC. 
AND The Attached Files sections and Contact Information sections will load the selected Origin for editing.  
AND Each individual Contact Info section will have its own Origin toggle in edit mode, as will the Attached Files section. 
AND Changing any of these will update the remainder (so all match at all times). 
AND Attempting to switch Origins will prompt the user that they are going to lose any changes already made. Confirming will load the new Origin in edit mode (along with the rest of the profile). Any edits made to the prior version of the Contact Information will not be maintained. 
AND There will be a "Save" and a "Cancel" button available in edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any unsaved changes. If they confirm, the system will reload the profile in View mode, with no changes made. 
OR Clicking "Save" will run a required field and formatting check. Assuming the required field and format check passes, the system will reload the profile in View mode, with the changes stored and visible.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a user I want to add a Registration Profile to my Club registration List via the Create New
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user is logged in with permission to Create Registration Profile and Add Registration Profile to their club
AND user is creating a new Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Register" on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN The System will run a duplicate check per prior stories. 
AND If a match is found that the Club has permission to see per #155273643 (no such restrictions exist for BOC users) and it is a registration profile that has not yet been added to the Club's Registration List, per #155273652, then selecting the existing Registration profile and clicking "Add to Club Reg List" will perform the following actions: 
  -  The Registration Profile should be added to the viewing Org's Club Registration List for the relevant Signing Period, based on the player's Eligible to Sign Date. 
  - The system should navigate the user to the existing Registration profile in edit mode. 
  - The Club user should have the ability to add their own Contact Information and Attached Files to the Registration Profile. They should not be able to view the Contact Info or Attached Files of other Clubs - nor should they be able to edit any other information on the profile.
  - Regardless of what actions they take while on the Registration Profile itself - the player should appear on the Club's Registration List from that point forward, and therefore be visible to the Org in searches and widgets.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Adding+a+Player+to+the+Club+Registration+List

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches

title: As a Club user I want to be able to check the registration status of a player after the Registration Period has ended
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Club user logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND Registration Period has ended
custom_steps: WHEN user try to Register a profile
custom_expected:
THEN There is a system date for each year that is the "registration cut off date".  It is composed of a date and time component.  (Registration Period end date/time on the system dates screen)
AND Prior to the specified date and time, both BOC users and Club users can create Registration profiles for the upcoming Signing Period. 
AND After the specified date and time, Club users should no longer see a "Register" button on the Create New when they have entered the DOB for a player subject to register. The button should now read "Check Registration"
AND The entry of grandfathered players is unaffected. 
AND Entering player information in the Create New and clicking "Check Registration" should run a standard matching check for the player based on the matching rules (all covered in prior stories). 
AND If no match is found, display Message #16.
OR If a match is found, display Message #4. 
AND Club users should still be able to add players to their Club Registration List outside of the Registration period, but if a match is found to an Unregistered profile they do not see a "Register MLSB" button, nor should they see a "Register" button to continue with the registration process with their entered information.


Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to Register an Unregistered Profile from Create New
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user is viewing the create new widget
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Register" on the matching modal
custom_expected:
THEN The system will Load the Unregistered profile in edit mode. The profile will look like a normal registration profile, just will also have the Scouting Info section visible and editable.
AND The Club user will be able to edit all of the profile's fields. 
AND The Club user will have a "Save" and "Cancel" button just like they do when normally creating a Registration Profile.
AND Clicking "Save" will run the same required field and formatting checks that would be run if they were otherwise entering a Registration Profile. 
AND Once the required field and formatting checks have passed, the profile's Registration Status will update to "Pending BOC Review". 
AND The Scouting Info will continue to display. 
AND If the user clicks "Cancel" or otherwise navigates away from the profile prior to completing the registration process, the profile's Registration Status is not updated, and no changes to the profile are stored.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Adding+a+Player+to+the+Club+Registration+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a BOC user I want to merging 2 profiles to maintain the first Level 1 Registration date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget 
AND user has selected two player from the Red Admin widget using the check box
AND user has selected which Master records to keep
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Merge"
custom_expected:
THEN Once the profiles have been merged, the player's Level 1 Registration date will be the earliest date that this player was registered, regardless of which player's information is selected as "Master". 

*NOTE TO QA: players can be merged multiple times - all of these merge stories will need to be tested accordingly.*

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration_admin
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge

Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Merging+Players+subject+to+Registration

GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget 
AND user has selected two player from the Red Admin widget using the check box

custom_expected:
THEN Once the profiles have been merged, the "Originally Registered By' will be maintained based on the Org and user that registered the player first, regardless of which player's information is selected as "Master"

*NOTE TO QA: players can be merged multiple times - all of these merge stories will need to be tested accordingly.*

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Merging+Players+subject+to+Registration

title: As a BOC user I want to merging 2 profiles to maintain Scouting Information
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget 
AND user has selected two player from the Red Admin widget using the check box
AND user has selected which Master records to keep
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Merge"
custom_expected:
THEN Once the profiles have been merged, the Scouting Info subsection will be maintained as entered if it exists for only one of the two profiles, regardless of which player's information is selected as "Master"
AND In the unique scenario that this information exists for both profiles selected for merge, then use the information for the player that is specified as the "Master" for the Bio Information

*NOTE TO QA: players can be merged multiple times - all of these merge stories will need to be tested accordingly.*

title: As a BOC user I want to merging 2 profiles to maintain any "tags"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget 
AND user has selected two player from the Red Admin widget using the check box
AND user has selected which Master records to keep
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Merge"
custom_expected:
THEN Once the profiles have been merged, the profile should display as having been "registered by" any Org that registered or added to their Club Reg List either of the two profiles that were merged. 
  * Example: Player 1 was Registered by BOC, and added to Club Reg List by ARI, BOS and Player 2 was Registered by BOC and added to Club Reg List by MLSB, CIN - after the merge the "new" profile will display as having additional registrations by ARI, BOS, MLSB and CIN - and all of those Orgs will continue to see the player on their Club Reg Lists.

*NOTE TO QA: players can be merged multiple times - all of these merge stories will need to be tested accordingly.*

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration_admin
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge

Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Merging+Players+subject+to+Registration

custom_expected:

custom_expected:

title: As a BOC user I want to select 2 International Profiles for merge
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Mergers Permission for International player
AND user navigates to "Registration Admin widget"
custom_steps: WHEN user selected two profiles in the Reg Admin
custom_expected:
THEN Users with International player mergers permission see a "Merge" button on the Registration Admin widget.
AND When exactly two profiles are selected in the Reg Admin, the "Merge" button is enabled. 
AND Selecting two profiles and clicking "Merge" will prompt the user to confirm the merge, and to select the "Master" information that they wish to keep. See Messages #20
AND See wireframe for layout of/information contained in message. 
AND If one of the profiles selected is an Unregistered profile, then the message will NOT have the option to select Master Information that is not entered in the MLSB profile (like attached files). 
OR If one of the profiles has more than one set of Origin information - use the following hierarchy to determine which Contact Info/Files to show:
 1- Master
 2- BOC
 3 - First Registering Org
 4 - MLSB (should only be used if it is the only available Origin)

*The actual merge is covered in another story*

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration_admin
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a BOC user I want to merging 2 profiles to maintain Level 2 Registration information
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget 
AND user has selected two player from the Red Admin widget using the check box
AND user has selected which Master records to keep
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Merge"
custom_expected:
THEN Once the profiles have been merged, any Level 2 Registration information will be maintained regardless of which player's information is selected as "Master".
  * Example - if either of the profiles were selected for Level 2 Registration or Elevated, the merged profile will maintain this - regardless of which was selected as the Master.
AND In the unique scenario that this information exists for both profiles selected for merge, then use the earliest entered information for the Level 2 Registered Date. For the Selected By fields use all Organizations from both profiles selected for merge. 

*NOTE TO QA: players can be merged multiple times - all of these merge stories will need to be tested accordingly.*

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration_admin
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge

Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Merging+Players+subject+to+Registration

title: As a BOC user I want to merge 2 Profiles
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget 
AND user has selected two player from the Red Admin widget using the check box
AND user has selected which Master records to keep
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Merge"
custom_expected:
THEN If they choose to click "Cancel" then the modal closes and no merge is taken. The user is returned to the Registration Admin with no changes saved. A
AND If they click "Merge" then the system will merge the two selected profiles. 
AND The Bio Information selected as the "Master" will now be the record for ANY user that loads that profile in the system. 
AND The system will need to maintain a record of the merge, and maintain BOTH player IDs. 
AND The attached files selected as "Master" will display under the MASTER origin for BOC users. 
AND The contact information selected as "Master" will display under the MASTER origin for BOC users. 
AND Any Origins that were available on BOTH profiles are also available to the BOC under the "Origin" dropdown.  (Ex: If Player 1 had Origins of BOC and MLSB, and Player 2 had Origins of BOC and BOS, the profile after the merge will have Master, BOC - 1, BOC- 2, MLSB and BOS)
AND The player will only appear once in the Reg Admin widget, Club Reg List and any searches using the new "Master" Bio information.
AND Clubs continue to see ONLY their own Contact information and Attached Files. 

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration_admin
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge

Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Merging+Players+subject+to+Registration

*Additional merge rules covered in followup stories*
*NOTE TO QA: players can be merged multiple times - all of these merge stories will need to be tested accordingly.*

title: As a BOC user I want merging two international player profiles to bring over any relevant Investigation info
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget 
AND user has selected two player from the Red Admin widget using the check box
AND user has selected which Master records to keep
custom_steps: When user click "Merge"
custom_expected:
THEN the system should check to see if either of the players has an Investigation or Investigation Request associated with them. 
AND Regardless of which profile is selected as the "Master", all available Investigations and Investigation Requests need to be maintained and available via the newly merged profile. 
AND All relevant updates to player information and/or Player ID should also be sent to LARI per #139253907.

title: As a Club user I want to see an Are you Sure message if I attempt to override a match message
custom_preconds:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

GIVEN a user is attempting to register a new international registration profile
AND the user has entered data in the create new fields that triggers a 4 of 7 match
AND user has clicked "Register"
AND matching modal has a "Register" button available
AND matching modal has a "Register MLSB entered" or "Add to Club Reg List" options (where applicable)
custom_steps: WHEN Club user clicks "Register" on the matching message
custom_expected:
THEN the system should ask if the user is sure that they wish to create the profile anyway
AND Messages #30: "Matches were found to this player. Please make sure that you have reviewed the matches and the profile does not yet exist in the system prior to continuing." 
AND if user clicks "Ignore and Continue" system should continue with registering the profile
BUT if user clicks "Back" system should cancel the registration and take user back to entry point

title: As a user I want matching messages to default to NOT creating a new profile unless that is the only way forward
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Club and BOC user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
AND user tries to register a player with the information that match the existing international player profile on the system
custom_steps: WHEN user user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN user is presented with a matching message from the Create New widget, the system should default the selection on the matching message to that which already exists in the system, unless there are no other actions that can be taken. 
 - Example: If a user is attempting to register a player and the system finds a match to another player not yet on their Club Reg List, the matching message displayed should have the first "System matches" match found selected, and the "Add to Club Reg List" button activated by default. 
AND The user should have the ability to select the new information and proceed with Registration anyway, assuming that they otherwise would have been able to (no rules/system dates stopping them).

title: As a scouting user I want to see a warning if I am attempting to enter a new unregistered player profile that matches another profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in with permission to create unregistered player profile
custom_steps: WHEN user tries to create unregistered player profile that matches another profile
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Next" on the Create New when creating a new Unregistered player profile will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to another international player profile that the user has permission to see as a match, then the user gets an error. See Messages #7. 
AND The same visibility rules should also apply to the "Add Player" check on Daily Reports.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a Club user I want to see a warning if I am attempting to enter a new player profile that matches another profile (updated)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Club user logs in with permission to creating a new International Amateur profile
custom_steps: WHEN user Clicks "Next" on the Create New when creating a new International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to another international player profile that the user has permission to see as a match, then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4 or #5.
AND MLSB Group 1 or Group 2 profiles are no longer automatically public. 
AND International Suspects should NOT appear as matches to Club users.
AND Unregistered International Prospects should ONLY appear as a match to Club users if they have a record status of Approved.
AND The remainder of the visibility restrictions should continue to work.
AND Register MLSB Entered and Add to Club Reg list functionality should continue to work as previously laid out.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a BOC user I want to see a warning if I am attempting to enter a new player profile that matches another profile (updated)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user logs in with permission to create new International Amateur profile
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Next" on the Create New when creating a new International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules (NOT via the Scouting dashboard). 
AND If a match is found to another international player profile, including to an International Suspect profile, then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4 or #5.
AND International Suspects SHOULD appear as matches to BOC users. They should have the option to Register MLSB entered for these profiles, just like any other Unregistered profile. 
AND Unregistered International Prospects should ONLY appear as a match to BOC users if they have a record status of Approved UNLESS the BOC user also has the ability to create unregistered profiles. If they have that permission, then they also see matches to Submitted profiles.
AND Register MLSB Entered and Add to Club Reg list functionality should continue to work as previously laid out.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches an Unregistered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club and BOC user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN user user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to an international player profile that has a Registration Status of "Unregistered", then the user gets a warning. See Messages #5.
AND This check is also run on "Save" when the profile is being created for the first time.
AND This check is conditionally run on "Save" for subsequent saves. That workflow is covered in #155273711.
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND The "Register MLSB Entered" button should only be enabled if the information that matches the MLSB Unregistered Profile is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Register MLSB Entered" should navigate the user to the Unregistered MLSB entered profile. (Actual registration covered in a separate story). 
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again. 

*Note for QA - in the past we've seen behavior where if the user clicks "Cancel" goes back and makes edits (or doesn't) and clicks "Register" again the matching logic isn't kicked off again so make sure to test for this case*

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches_-_mlsb_unregistered

title: As a user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches a profile I have already entered or added to my Club registration List
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club and BOC user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN user user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to an international player profile that has a Registration Status of "Unregistered", then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4.
AND This check is also run on "Save" when the profile is being created for the first time.
AND This check is conditionally run on "Save" for subsequent saves. That workflow is covered in #155273711.
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. This is the default selection. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND Any matches to the entered information that belong to a profile that the Club registered or are already on the Club's Registration List are displayed as matches, but the radio buttons are greyed out or simply not displayed.  
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again. 

*Note for QA - in the past we've seen behavior where if the user clicks "Cancel" goes back and makes edits (or doesn't) and clicks "Register" again the matching logic isn't kicked off again so make sure to test for this case*

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches_-_mlsb_unregistered

title: As a user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches a registration profile I have not yet added to my Club registration List
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club and BOC user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN user user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to an international player profile that has a Registration profile that the user has not already Registered or added to their Club Reg List then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4.
AND This check is also run on "Save" when the profile is being created for the first time.
AND This check is conditionally run on "Save" for subsequent saves. That workflow is covered in #155273711.
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND The "Add to Club Reg List" button should only be enabled if the information that matches the existing Registration Profile is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Add to Club Reg List" should navigate the user to the existing Registration profile. (Actual addition to the Club Reg List is covered in a separate story). 
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again. 

*Note for QA - in the past we've seen behavior where if the user clicks "Cancel" goes back and makes edits (or doesn't) and clicks "Register" again the matching logic isn't kicked off again so make sure to test for this case*

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches_-_mlsb_unregistered

title: As a Club user I do NOT want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches a profile I do not have permission to see
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN club user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND Club users will only see a match per stories if they have permission to view the matching profile as a match. 
AND Club users are able to see a profile as a match under the following conditions: 
  - The player has been selected for L2 Registration by the BOC.
  - The player has been entered by the viewing Org.
  - The player has been added to the viewing Org's Club Reg List. 
  - The player has passed their Eligible to Sign Date. 
  - The player has been identified as a Group 1 or Group 2 player from their MLSB Reports. (flag on profile)
  - The player has been explicitly been made public by the BOC by a flag on their profile. 
BUT If none of the above conditions have been met - then the player may appear as a match only under the following conditions: 
        - The player has been registered and their First Review has been set to "Verified" or "Pre-Verified". 
        - The player is Unregistered and does not have a Scouting Status of "International Suspect".

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Visibility Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

title: As a BOC user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches another profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Create permissions for Registration Profile 
AND user navigates to International tab 
AND user is entering info that matches existing profile in the create new Registration Profile form
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Register" on the Create New will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules
custom_expected:
THEN If a match is found to another international player profile, then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4 or 5. This should work the same as for Club users, except there are no visibility restrictions for the BOC, so they will see matches to any matching profile in the system. 
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. This is the default selection. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND Any matches to the entered information that belong to a profile that the Club registered or are already on the Club's Registration List are displayed as matches, but the radio buttons are greyed out or simply not displayed. 
AND If any of the profile matches are Unregistered, there should be a "Register MLSB Entered" button available on the modal. If that profile is selected, the button should be enabled. Clicking the button should navigate the user to the Unregistered profile. 
AND If any of the profile matches are Registered, but not yet on the BOC's Club Registration list, there should be an "Add to Club Reg List" button available on the modal. If that profile is selected, the button should be enabled. 
AND Clicking the button should navigate the user to the relevant profile. 
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I only want to see matching warnings on "Save" of a profile if I have updated a matching related field
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user navigates to International tab
AND user is editing registered player profile
custom_steps: WHEN user clicking "Save" on an International Player Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will check to see if any of the matching related fields have been updated on the profile (First, Last, DOB, Twin Count, National ID, Birth City). This is done on initial save as well as subsequent saves.
AND If yes, then the system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found, the user gets a warning. See Messages #5.
OR If none of the matching related fields has been updated since the profile was loaded, the system does not perform a match check.


Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches_-_mlsb_unregistered

title: INC0166382 - As an Intl User, I want to see the International tab for a player who was drafted and signed as a domestic amateur
custom_steps:
Description: Some "domestic" players require Visa information.  These fields are located on the International tab, which is only displayed for international players.

AC:

* There will be a flag created in the db that will control if the international tab on a professional players profile
* If a "domestic" player has this flag set, the intl tab will be displayed and function as if the player were an intl player
* Test to see how link handles this.  If this doesn't work, a LINK story will need to be opened.



Received from: JJ.Estevez@nationals.com
Recipients: EBISSupport@mlb.com,ryan.thomas@nationals.com,patrick.nathanson@mlb.com

Hello,

Hope you are all well. Please see below. I am trying to update the Immigration information on two of our players' profiles on Ebis but they don't have an International Tab like all the international players do. The players are Paolo Espino and Francinel Martina. I think the reason is because they were both drafted here in the US and did not sign as International amateur players. However, since we have to add immigration information on their profiles, is there a way to add that tab for them?

title: As a User, I want to merge multiple Intl Amateur profiles at the same time
custom_steps:
- when you're merging a verified player with unregistered profiles, the verified one just wins and there's no decisions about master info
 - call it a multi merge and its a two step process?  You click on a specific player to start a multi merge and then check off everyone else you want to just get rolled into them?

title: Fix Logic Update Intl Verification Email
custom_steps:
There is an email that is sent to intl amateur players upon verification.  The dates/period logic in the email is hard coded, so emails going out after the system dates were changed are now incorrect.

AC:

* Update the email template to remove the placeholder and set it to 2020-21 for the year
* Set the Eligible to Sign Date to 1/15/2021
* The email that gets sent out will now reflect accurate signing periods and ETSDs

Confirm this is still necessary before doing anything.
